dialogues.text: Yall heard about the show we puttin on at the Honeydripper Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very modest wooden house with a porch.    LIGHTS on ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty and China Doll sit as Delilah lays dinner on the table She is dressed to go out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect there'll be a nice turnout for Bertha Mae tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks who wouldn't have nothin to do with her when she was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them, maybe. You still got to pay your respects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick gonna have to find him a new ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a terrible thing to say-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how the man gets over, is all, sugarin up to some woman got a job or a bankroll-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no way to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just how it is out in the world, baby- man got to walk through the gates of Hell to get a piece of cheese. He stares moodily, unnoticing as she lays his plate in fr of him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not so young any more, lose hold of what little you got- He just shakes his head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you lose the club I'm sure you'll find something else. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this town?   Like what? Delilah proceeds cautiously- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know anytime you want I could get Miss Amanda to ask her husb- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Watch yo feet, Mr. Mayor, I done just mopped the flo! " Delilah tries to ignore this- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work so hard at the Lounge, and what it brings in- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't even as much as what you make polishin that white lady's silver. I know. DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to. Delilah gives up, knowing he's set on his mood- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just have to work out, then. A strained silence.   Delilah crosses to the back door- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meetin gonna start without I'm there. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your soul not the one needs savin, baby. She gives Ty a lost look, steps out.   The screen door sl China Doll sees how worried Ty is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all gonna be fine, Daddy. Everbody in town talkin bout Guitar Sam comin to Harmony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHOIR sings at the front of the LANTERN-LIT tent, a CONGREGATION of salvation-seekers filling the benches-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother died- Yes she died and left me It was long- long time ago Oh but I searched Searched her record over I found mother just had to go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh she cried son, Son don't you worry Oh you know the Lord Always fix a way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah arrives at the rear of the tent, finds herself a on a bench-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left me standing Standing along the highway Oh wondering- which way I must go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND CUTLIP watches his singers, clapping out time wi his big hands-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I walked- All along the highway I was seeking my Lord each day She left me standing Standing along the highway Just wondering- which way must I go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Amens' and other sounds greet the end of the song. Rever Cutlip steps to the center of the platform and looks arou at the souls gathered-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND CUTLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway of Life, Brothers and Sisters, will twist you and turn you, it will run you this way and that way, it will tempt you with many a detour-- for the Highway of Life, Brothers and Sisters, is designed to lead us astray! He gets an `Amen!' from someone in the crowd- REVEREND CUTLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It meanders away from the Light and into the Darkness, it tires our legs and whittles away at our spirits! The congregation start to get into it, RESPONDING, rockin with the rhythm of the sermon, flapping their PAPER FANS advertise Beauchamp's Funeral Home in the hot night-- REVEREND CUTLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It snares us with the thorns and thistles of wickedness, it is paved with the black deeds of sinners and laid out on a crooked plan! That's not the road we want to be on, Brothers and Sisters, that's not the path we need to follow! The Reverend picks up speed- REVEREND CUTLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to get on that other road! The one that leads to salvation! The one that leads to glory! The one that leads to the right hand of God! Praise His name! CONGREGATION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord! REVEREND CUTLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thoroughfare I'm talking about, the righteous path we got to tread, is called the Highway to Heaven, and by the great Lord above it is straight and it is narrow! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND CUTLIP(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes on the prize and your feet on the street and you won't ever make a mis-step, you won't ever falter, you won't ever stumble, because Jesus will show you the Way! Several people in the audience are up and SHOUTING now, getting into the Spirit. Reverend Cutlip shifts gear, filling his voice with a sense of dread and warning-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you got to pay attention to who it is walking beside you, Brothers and Sisters, got to be wary against those who will hold you back from your journey! There's many a loved one got to be left behind! Cause you either on the road or you lost in the wilderness!

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: We TIGHTEN on Delilah as she listens, upset, taking this very personally-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You either headed for glory or doomed to damnation! You either in with the Lord or you in with the Devil- and they aint no in-between!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK past CELLS full of black PRISONERS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulsa aint so bad but for the smell-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got them stockyards near the jail-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right- and the flies. Course, I had me in a cell in Georgia once, six other men, didn't have no window atall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must of got caught on one a them freights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny is in a big COMMON CELL with the other conscripted LABOR GANG. He hangs on the bars as behind him men pitch pennies, while Ned and another veteran jailbird, KING, compare lodging experiences- KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, aint no free ride allowed through Georgia. And the food there- NED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paltry- KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paltry aint the word for it. Breakfast was a joke, lunch was a rumor- NED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and dinner was a anecdote. KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Spose you been locked in that box. NED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or one just like it. Sonny begins to SING softly, almost to himself- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you wake up in the morning Hear the bing-bong ring- Walk up to the table And see the same damn thing All Imonna tell you Knife, a fork and a pan If you say a thing about it You're in trouble with the Man The men join him on the chorus- ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the Midnight Special Shine its light on me Oh let the Midnight Special Shine its ever-lovin light on me- Sonny turns to face them- NED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a singer, young man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singer, guitar player- Imonna be on the radio some day. People gonna know my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Keep thinkin that way, young man. Judge Gatlin don't choose to work you into your grave, you just might do it. Sonny ponders this, looking back out through the bars, singing more moodily now as we TRACK AWAY from the cell-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever go to Houston Don't you stagger don't you fight Cause the Sheriff will arrest you You're in the cooler for the night-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the slow BLUES DIRGE Bertha May as we see China D applying polish to Bertha Mae's fingernails-

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. We TRACK BACK through the house, looking PHOTOGRAPHS and POSTERS of her singing in her glory days, finally TRACKING out onto the PORCH where Slick sits glum on the steps and the undertaker stands in his black suit, looking at his watch as MOURNERS begin to pass into the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES.   MOURNERS pass the OPEN COFFIN-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Ty and Maceo help carry the coffin down dirt road, Slick walking at the head of the mourners following it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as- Hands grip ropes as the coffin is lowered into the HOLE- Reverend Cutlip speaks a eulogy- Slick tries to keep it together- Scratch and Lonnie watch the ceremony from a tree branch- Ty looks at his watch, slips away from the funeral party. Delilah notices, frowns. Reverend Cutlip takes note as we A shovel digs into piled dirt- Dirt is tossed down upon us and the screen goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty waits for a train, still in his mourning suit. We TIGH on his face- tense, preoccupied with his schemes to save club-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear tell Miss Bertha Mae passed. Ty whirls around-- somehow he didn't see Possum, sitting bench behind him, guitar in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lived it how she sang it. Ty tries to ignore him, looks down the rails-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waitin for somebody. Ty is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aint nobody on that train gonna change your luck, Tyrone. Gonna have to save your own self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)    What you know about anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothin much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty steps away.    Possum speaks quietly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know you from way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possum starts PLAYING, a dark, moody, slide-guitar blues. Ty looks toward Possum, not happy he's there, then looks away. The MUSIC gets LOUDER, FASTER, Possum MOANING and WHOOPING, stomping his foot- We TIGHTEN on Ty's face, tighter, tighter, then DISSOLVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 We're in a   BAR ROOM- smoke, heat, packed bodies- Possum SONG grows   more intense as we TRACK IN on GUITAR MAN- y with slick   hair a moustache and tons of attitude. He sn flicks his   cigarette almost straight at us. We TRACK IN on YOUNG TYRONE, also swearing, stepping away from his piano- Guitar Man hands his guitar to one of the eager MEN stand close, hoping for a fight- A PRETTY GIRL stands to one side, looking scared and exci covering her mouth with her hands- Young Tyrone steps in to meet him, the CROWD around almos pushing them together- Guitar Man pulls out a KNIFE! Young Tyrone grabs for it a they grapple, face to face, struggling in a terrible danc A TRAIN WHISTLE breaks the spell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 Possum stops playing and cocks his head to listen- The WHISTLE again as the TRAIN APPROACHES. Ty takes a deep breath, hoping-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mourners are walking back down the country road where we the coffin carried. Reverend Cutlip sidles up to Delilah-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mournful end for a wayward sinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always seemed at peace with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company she kept, the life she led-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew Bertha Mae to do hurt to a living soul. The Reverend is not too pleased with Delilah's forgiving attitude-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all hoping to see you get over and accept the Lord tonight, Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping so too. Cutlip nods toward the FIELD as they pass the PRISON LABO GANG, picking cotton under guard-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been lingering at the threshold long enough, Sister. Time to step ahead. Delilah tries not to show how shaken she is by this challenge. She passes out of frame and we see China Doll bringing up the rear of the funeral party, lost in though She looks over into the cotton field-

dialogues.speaker: SONNY, PRISON LABOR GANG
dialogues.text: Sonny bends his back with the other laborers, picking and sweating-

dialogues.speaker: CHINA DOLL
dialogues.text: China Doll pauses, frowns as she sees it is Sonny working DEPUTY strolling past him, shotgun in hand. Sonny sees he lowers his head in shame-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN has just pulled into the station.       A pair PULLMAN PORTERS step out-- But nobody else. Ty feels his heart sink. Shack Thomas comes up behind him carrying an overnight bag-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone- got somebody gettin off here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He halts by Ty for a moment, watching.      Nobody else i stepping out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the party's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam- Guitar Sam-- don't know his birth name-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) He's comin here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls to the porters further up the platform-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Nat!    Guitar Sam get on this train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, man. He's in the hospital back in Little Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know music folks- whatever he was doin, he must have done too much of it. The porters LAUGH. Shack, realizing this must be a setbac for Ty, pats his shoulder before he steps onto the train-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, brother- maybe he be in tomorrow. We FOLLOW Ty away from the train as Nat calls `All aboard and the engine gathers power. Possum sits listening to the single SLIDE NOTES he plays, if tuning his guitar-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody didn't show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) Wish they'd made you dumb instead of blind. We HOLD on Possum, cackling darkly, as Ty walks away.   T train WHISTLE BLOWS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A torn and crumpled Guitar Sam POSTER lays on the bar counter. FINGERS move on the keyboard. Ty sits drinking, brooding, PLAYING and SINGING softly at piano. Maceo is at the bar-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I had my fun if I Don't get well no more Well I had my fun if I Don't get well no more My head is spinnin And I'm goin down slow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man don't take care of hisself- out drinkin and jazzin the women every night-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make any difference now. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got so bad, I heard there was some ole boy goes around pretendin to be Guitar Sam, fill out the gigs he misses. Does pretty well for hisself, what I hear- Ty pauses on the keyboard- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody we could find? MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Hell, I don't know.     Just a story I heard. They both go back to brooding.   Ty takes a drink.   He s at the keyboard- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must have been a first one. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First what? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back slavery days, they had the ones that worked in the big house. Might not of had shoes always, but their pants didn't have no holes and they didn't pick no cotton. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House niggers. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how they called em. They must of had all their African kinda instruments- drums, shakers, some kind of banjo thing- but the piano- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't bring no piano over on them ships from Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The piano was just sittin there in the white folks' big room, all polished up-- and I figure this one boy, he goes past fifteen, twenty times a day, running the corner of his eye over it. And he's there when they play, the masters, doin all their minuets and whatever- Ty PLAYS something like a MINUET- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -him standing there with a tray of white people food pretendin not to have a thought in his head, might be only some dust hangin in the air for all they know- but he's watchin the fingers, see, watchin them keys work. This old boy, the first one, he can play alla them Africa kinda instruments, he can play mud if you give him the key and the tempo, he's got music in his head, in his heart, in every damn piece of him there's music. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down to the bones-- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one day the masters is away, huntin foxes or some rich white people thing they get up to, and he's alone in the room with that piano and he comes over and sits down on the bench- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out now- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and he spreads his fingers out the way he seen the minuet player do- and he- Ty hits a MINOR CHORD, lets it decay- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he thinks- `Lord help me, I could do some damage with this.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence.    Maceo is moved by the scene- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would have liked to been there. I mean to hear the cat play, not none of the rest of it. Ty gets up and crosses the room with his drink in his han distraught. This is the end for Ty, no strategies left, nothing but the bitter taste of total defeat- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mace, Imonna lose my club. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Man Toussaint finds out you stole his liquor, you like to lose more than that- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no more cards to play- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you was to go down, see Lucky Hardaway in person- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) I aint kissin up to no cokey-nose, conk-headed- WHAP! He kicks Sonny's guitar case, left sticking out und a table, and sends it spinning across the floor till it CRASHES into the bar and flips open. Ty and Maceo stare a the contents- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell that sposed to be? Maceo pulls out a home-built SOLID BODY GUITAR, a painted white rectangle with a complicated PICKUP jury-rigged ove the strings and yards of ELECTRICAL CORD hanging off it- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of guitar. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guitar has got a hole in it, that's where the sound comes from. That boy must be bout three bricks shy of a load upstairs. China Doll rushes in, upset-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gone and arrest him! TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrested who? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny. The high Sheriff arrested him and sold him over to Judge Gatlin. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Sonny? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny that was here yesterday morning. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny that got a screw loose is why they arrested him. Maceo, make a noise on that- Maceo plucks a string.    Not much of a sound- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's electric- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I plug a chunk of stove wood into the wall I get more music out of it than that mess gonna make. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, man, it don't work unless it's hooked up to the juice, see? You got the juice, you don't need the hollow inside the box, the music just runs straight from the strings through this wire and comes out- He dumps the sack Sonny brought out and outs falls a mass tubes and wires, also home-modified- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -your amplifier. Which is what this thing must be. CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny said he fix radios in the Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny didn't do nothin but feed bedbugs in anybody's Army, and some of em crawled in his head. Surprised if that boy got the wit to pick cotton. Judge Gatlin bought himself a droolin idiot. What you want to amplify a damn guitar for anyway? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less you gonna sit over on your chair and play them little Charley Christian kind of riffs- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sideman- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit over there and be all clean and polite. Guitar hasn't been up front since them old piss and moan blues shouters, sit their blind asses on the corner hollerin for pennies- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old time music- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, Sonny didn't do nothin to be arrested for! He was just lookin for work. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hung colored boys for less than that, darlin. Least on the work gang they feed em, keep their strength up. CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't belong there! Maceo turns the guitar over in his hands- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Guitar Sam plays him an electric, but I don't think it's this no-hole kind of deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he plugs it in the wrong socket some night, lectrocutes his sorry no-show ass! Ty has a thought.    He looks over at the guitar in Maceo hands- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking out loud) Now if he did show up here-- and our power was to go out again while he was playing- MACEO (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I fixed it good this time, Ty. Ty smiles- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he come out and plugs his ax in- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He come out lookin good, from what I hear. All kind of spangly pants and jacket, got his name spelled out on the back- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes, right- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair all slick and shiny, flash some gold teeth at them gals, got his sax man behind him, maybe a piano, harmonica, drums- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that night the lights went out in the Esquire Club in Mobile? MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) And somebody took off with the gate? Stole the whole damn register off the counter- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't hold it against Reggie Porter, did they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw- it was his place that got robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't hold it against him, didn't expect no money back for the show-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all too busy diving on the pot of that tonk game got interrupted-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody suspected it might be Reggie Porter hisself that pulled them lights, did they? Maceo begins to see where Ty is leading-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, no, Ty, we can't- Ty claps his hands together, jumps up and heads for the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: China Doll, you mind the place while we're gone! (to Maceo) Come on, man, we got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise the people Guitar Sam, they gonna get Guitar Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start on a portrait of Governor Big Jim Folsom on the wall, then TILT DOWN to Sheriff Pugh, feet up on the desk table-top FAN pointed at him, looking up at Ty-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you interested in this boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a job for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be doin pretty good for yourself out there, Tyrone, you hirin new people on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing well, yeah- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this boy- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name is Sonny- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's payin off his debt to society right now, and if I was to pull him out of the field it would cost the county- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Gatlin payin three a day for prison labor. SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna pay me four for the duration of his sentence? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which might be- ? SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -as long as I care to make it. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was counting on more of a one-time deal- if I could just rent him out for the weekend- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty dollars. Ty looks stricken- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the money. There's legalistic principles involved here. Public safety issues- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pay you Sunday morning? SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay me now or you forget about it. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you too smart for the rest of us, don't you, Tyrone? Think you can go it by yourself. He puts his feet down and sits forward, drilling Ty with eyes- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd rather eat roofin nails than come to me for a favor- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a favor if I got to pay- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you gonna pay all right. You don't hand me that money Sunday mornin, you got yourself a new partner. Same deal as I got with Toussaint. How'd that be? Ty considers.   He doesn't have any options- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)    You'll get the fifty. SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)    And that wife of yours- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary)   Delilah- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them fried chicken sandwiches- if I was to come by, now and then, check up on my interests- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She be happy to fix you whatever you want. SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife's cookin would gag a maggot. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different people got different kinds of talents. Sheriff Pugh heaves himself to his feet-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lurleen aint discovered what hers is yet. Let's go fetch that boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOTGUN in a deputy's arms-

dialogues.speaker: PICKERS
dialogues.text: Faces dripping sweat, prison gang pickers stoop to their

dialogues.speaker: TY
dialogues.text: Ty stands by his beat-up old Ford at the side of the road watching, remembering. A few of the PRISON LABORERS look up, curious, as Sonny i led over-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the one? Ty nods, looks to Sonny-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any ideas about turning rabbit on me, you best get rid of em now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You payin my way out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come? They get INTO THE CAR-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like draggin that cotton sack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't ask questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty pulls away, leaving the less fortunate stooped in the field-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC plays on the RADIO as Nadine masterfully works her SEWING MACHINE and Maceo stands by uneasily. He holds up denim jacket Sonny left at the club-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This size, right, but it's got to shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you need this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) That's a tall order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fishing) You know, I do my best work, my fastest work, when I'm happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I spose you do- Nadine looks up at him from the sewing machine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gone make me happy, baby? Maceo nervously makes for the door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm- you come by the club tonight, we havin a special show. Tell em at the door you my guest-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food aint the only thing a woman needs three times a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) Wouldn't hurt you to skip a few meals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, baby? Maceo turns at the open door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy's gonna need time to try that jacket on- see how it feels. Later, Nadine- He is gone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty and China Doll stand looking at Sonny as he sits on a stool-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to do somethin with this boy's head, darlin. They might not know what the real Sam look like, but it aint this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try. China Doll looks through the beauty products she's piled nearby-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what exactly I'm supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gone stand up there with that contraption you got an play Guitar Sam numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I do that with my eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could get the audience to close theirs we be better off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty- Maceo pops his head in the front door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tracked Mr. Trenier down- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hit it. Ty leaves to join Maceo- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Daddy. China Doll is a little nervous to be left alone with Sonn She puts her comb in her hand and walks around Sonny, examining his hair while he examines her face- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you're doing? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fix Mama's hair all the time. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you aint been to that school yet. CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to school to learn your guitar? SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)   No. China Doll steps behind the bar- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might pick up some new things at beauty school but mostly it's for my certificate, and that is `a ticket to adventure'- that's what it says in the brochure. People lookin for beauty all over the world. Sonny sees the LOOSE WIRES that come through the wall beh the bar. China Doll searches around- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to watch out for them wires sticking down- don't look safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Yeah- power's always going out, people getting shocks and whatnot- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody ought to fix it. She searches under the counter for something- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `A career in beauty is like money in the bank.' Says that in the brochure too. Plus it isn't physically taxin. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't see no pretty thing like you behind a plow. CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the rheumatic fever when I was little, left me with a weak heart. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Mine been actin funny too- since I laid eyes on you. She acknowledges his flirting with a little smile and com up with a MASON JAR full of clear LIQUID- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some ole moonshine they keep around. China Doll crosses back to Sonny- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) What you gonna do with it? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always joke about how this stuff'll straighten your hair right out- She twists the lid off, sniffs the liquid, reacts to its strength-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imonna just make yours relax a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME TRENIER, an older musician with a permanently stoic expression, sits watching his pupil, a YOUNG BOY, torture SCALES with a CORNET. He glances up at Ty and Maceo, tryi not to plug their ears as the boy continues to PLAY-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Time Trenier- that's a name to be reckoned with. Time doesn't seem to react to the flattery-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Story goes that you used to play with Buddy Bolden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Played with most all of em down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And King Oliver-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One band falls apart you find yourself another one. Never any shortage of bands, down New Awlins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you was givin lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pays the rent.   Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You interested in a playin job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative) It's uhm- backin up a man on the electric guitar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)     If you can pay, I can play. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to dress sharp. No need to say this to Time Trenier.       You could cut on the creases on his pants- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It aint like a all-night thing- you just start out and there's gonna be a accident- Ty shoots Maceo a look- TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accident. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden loss of power.      Lights out. TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs again)      It's your gig, man. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock. This aint colored people time and it sure aint New Awlins time. I mean eight o'clock on the money. TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got the green I'm on the scene. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a deal then. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know any drummers? TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)     I'll bring you one. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin fancy, he just got to keep time- TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is my name. Ty and Maceo wince as the kid hits a particularly SOUR NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The free pickers are lined up at the side of the road-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white CLERK sits behind a wooden table in front of the transport truck and pulls cash from a METAL BOX, consulti thick LEDGER in front of him as he pays the pickers off. Sheriff Pugh observes, his patrol car parked nearby. Ham has come to the head of the line, Junebug behind him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenny-four, twenny-five, twenny- six, twenny-seven, twenny-eight. Make your mark here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)   Owe me thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book says twenny-eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollar fifty every hundred pound, and I picked-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars deducted for stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't put no stones in the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We mill the cotton, there's always stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there wasn't none in my sack-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take off two dollars a week, always have. Aint that right, Junebug? Junebug knows it's useless to complain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes suh.   Been that way my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham is furious but has nowhere to go with it- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna take your pay, son, or give it up to charity? Ham swipes his pay off the table, stalks away.    Sheriff glares after him. We FOLLOW Ham as he crosses to the rear of the truck. sits on the tailgate, grinning at him- DEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't let nobody mess with my money like that. HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took the same two dollars off yours. DEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you could pave a highway with the rocks I threw in that mess. He catches the eye of Lucille, standing nearby- DEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You country nigros let the crackers run you like dogs- SNATCH! Ham grabs Dex by the shirt front and yanks him close, hissing in fury- HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sheriff wasn't here I'd snap your neck, boy. SHERIFF PUGH (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me stop you. Ham turns to see Sheriff Pugh standing behind him, a wry smile on his face- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first you gonna sign that ledger like you sposed to. Don't want nobody cryin they didn't get their due.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty is repairing the little STAGE with hammer and nails-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Purvis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't look up) People call me Ty or they call me Pinetop. Mr. Pinetop to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you- I preciate the opportunity. Ty looks up to see Sonny with his hair pressed under a ti cap made from an old STOCKING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know ever one of Guitar Sam's songs- know the chords, know the words-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. Sonny begins to stroll around the edge of the club, looki at PHOTOS and SHOWBILLS on the walls-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: China Doll said how you was famous once. Ty is pleased at his step-daughter's bragging, but doesn' show it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was known, but I was never what you call famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get your start? Ty sighs, sits back from his work-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in Mobile there was an old cathouse professor name of Joe Dudlow, had had a stroke on one side, curled him all up- but he kept on pluggin. I used to come out and play his left hand for him. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old you were? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Thirteen, fourteen. This one night it was goin hot and heavy and Joe just passed, right there at the piano, in the middle of Black Bottom Stomp. They propped him up at the bar, stuck a drink in his hand, and told me to keep poundin them ivories. (shakes his head) There was a meanness hanging over them juke joints, there was murder in the air. You stopped playin for a minute, it come down like a flock of crows. Sonny stops by a poster for the `REGINALD ERSKINE BAND featuring Tyrone "Pinetop" Purvis'- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is you- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big band days, on the road. If a railroad train run through it, we played it. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) `Reginald Erskine'. Don't believe I ever heard of him- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big tall light-skin fella out of Carolina, said he's part Cherokee. Couldn't play nothin, but he waved his little stick and had this long greasy hair he throw around like Cab Calloway. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were the piano man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piano man, arranger, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must of been somethin, see the country first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about first class, but we seen the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you stopped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Got tired of carrying another man's water. Didn't want to die in no colored hotel some night in Who-Knows-Where Arkansas. He bangs the last nail in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Met Delilah and wanted something of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you don't have nothing to worry about, Mr. Pinetop. I won't let you down tonight. Ty looks at Sonny, considers telling him what the plan is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-   I don't spose you will. Ty gets up and goes into the back. Sonny crosses to the tangle of wires coming out of the wa behind the counter and snaking off in every direction. He grabs hold of one, thinking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah is in her kitchen, HUMMING a GOSPEL SONG to herse apron on as she begins to make a pie. She pulls a METAL FLOUR CANNISTER down from the shelf, flips the lid off- a half full. She starts to scoop flour out from it and something falls a small CLOTH PURSE. She picks it up to put it aside, the frowns at the way it feels. She shakes flour off, unzips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maceo loads bottles of beer into the ICEBOX, wincing as t sounds of a SCREAMING ARGUMENT blast in from the bar-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imonna put that back and double-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't go gamblin with my baby's money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to send off the advance pay or the man don't come and play-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you took it for, I saved that money up for China Doll- Delilah bursts through the swinging door into the back ro pursued by Ty, trying to explain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and you got no business puttin your fingers on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: China Doll don't need any school, baby, she could walk into one of them shops right this minute and get a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be some line you won't cross, some thing you won't do-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world starts throwin me breaks, woman, maybe I'll catch religion and walk the straight and narrow like them Bible thumpers you sit up with, but till that day, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Cutlip is right about you! WHAM! Delilah slams the back door as she storms out. Ty turns and CRACK! kicks an empty crate halfway across the floor before stomping out to the bar. Maceo opens a beer with the church-key hanging from the icebox handle, takes gulp and sits to ponder this new development-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the revival meeting CHOIR SINGING an upbeat numbe Opal, dressed for Saturday night, checks herself out in a spotted, cracked MIRROR and works on her make-up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to choose Got to choose tween the fire and the Light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Luther struts around a corner in the bla section of town, dressed up to party. Behind him we see a half-dozen other YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN, all decked out, mov toward the railroad tracks-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You   got to choose Got   to choose tween the fire and the   Light All   you sinners Got   to choose tween the fire and the   Light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. A trio of BLACK PRIVATES share a mirror, spiffing up their uniforms to go out on leave-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No earthly love Is gonna make it right! You got to choose-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Dex, dressed to go out, pulls a SHOEBOX from under the cot he sits on. He lifts the lid to reveal old .38 PISTOL-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got   to choose tween the world and the   Lord You   got to choose Got   to choose tween the world and the   Lord

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. We TRACK toward the barracks-like housin for itinerant workers as PICKERS come out, cleaned up and ready to celebrate-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you sinners Got to choose tween the world and the Lord Ham walks alone. We see him stuff his ROLL of single doll BILLS into one pocket, tuck a FOLDING KNIFE into the othe He passes a telephone pole and we HOLD on the Guitar Sam POSTER tacked up on it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train is leavin Better jump on board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah arrives at the revival tent, the CHOIR already

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to kneel Got to kneel for the Savior and pray You got to kneel Got to kneel for the Savior and pray

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. The BLUE LIGHTS of the SIGN come on. PEOPLE fill the yard in front, heading into the Honeydrip Metalmouth collects COVER CHARGE at the door, MONEY passi hands-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you sinners Got to kneel for the Savior and pray Aint no hidin From the Judgement Day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe fifty people are in the club already, mostly LOCALS HARVEST HANDS, with more arriving all the time- Ty stands watching the crowd, tense, not at all confident that any of his scheme is going to work- A group of twenty of the black SOLDIERS from the base ste Maceo comes over and lays a hand on his shoulder-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natives gettin restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna be full up.   But the food- Delilah comin in? Ty's expression gives him the answer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I lost her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't let you down, Ty-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This aint gonna work, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got to play it out and see-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)    Guitar Sam! They look out at the growing crowd.   Ty is grim-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can push another round of drinks while I stall em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you gonna bring him out? Dex is joined by several OTHERS in the club, calling out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! We come to hear the guitar man play! Guitar Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be on those wires. Give him three bars and then you pull it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a baseball bat under the counter, but you out here all alone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the liquor movin, Mace, and keep that money where you can run with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Cutlip holds forth under the LANTERN LIGHT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord don't want nobody to sit back suffering! He wants you to stand up! He wants you to rise up! He wants you to step forward! He wants you rush down into the merciful arms of His eternal salvation! Many of the congregation are up on their feet, clapping a testifying-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone out here tonight gonna answer His call? Is there anyone out here tonight gonna come forward and be saved?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Delilah is standing, tears running down her cheeks, fille with the emotion of the moment-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is heatin up, Brothers and Sisters, and Judgement Day is nigh! Aint no time to hesitate, you got to come on down and take Him into your heart! Delilah starts to walk down the aisle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right- come on down! They no turning back now- feel the Lord's hand at your back- got to leave all them sinners behind! Delilah stops in the middle of the aisle, trembling, unsu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees her) You got a voice in your heart, Sister- that's the Lord talking! You hear him? Delilah starts to nod her head, weeping-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That voice telling you where you need to be right now! You just got to move your feet and get there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: China Doll fusses with Sonny's hair after he hangs his guitar, dangling with electrical hookups, over his head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good. Ty steps back in with them, wiping sweat from his forehea with a handkerchief. He looks Sonny over- his hair slick and shiny, the outfit Nadine sewed up for him tight and sparkling-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Damn-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks good, doesn't he Daddy? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I want you to get right by that front door and take over collectin the cover charge. And if anything should happen- like go wrong or something- you just step out and walk away from the club, hear? CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gonna go wrong? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh- our Guitar Sam here gets them soldier boys jumping it could get a little rough- just be on your toes, that's all. CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She starts away- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: China Doll- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there aint a thing in this world I wouldn't do for you. Even if I mess up sometimes, you know that, right? China Doll looks at him, not sure what brought this on, b pleased to hear it. The CALLS for Guitar Sam grow LOUDER from the floor- CHINA DOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, Daddy. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go on, now. China Doll exits and Ty looks back to Sonny- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you look like something might of come outa New Orleans-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget to tell you- I fixed your hook-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the electricity comes in?    It was all-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty! They turn to see Maceo stepping in, concerned-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a situation out there-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got the law in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Pugh stands near the piano, putting a considerabl damper on the mood in the room. Ty hurries out to him, wi a panic-stricken smile on his face-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think we'd be seeing you so soon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Got a nice crowd in here tonight, Tyrone. See them army uniforms-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well we got ourselves this special attraction, see, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them ribs outside smell real good, but I got my heart set on some of your Delilah's fried chicken. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made it last Saturday at the mayor's but ole Clayford Gentry was up from Eufala and he got the drumsticks. Sheriff Pugh is distracted for a moment as Opal and the g from the store step in, dressed to the nines, drinking up eyeball action from the pickers and soldiers- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm partial to dark meat. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the thing is- SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is back there cookin, aint she? Our agreement was- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation we got, Sheriff, what with this special guest come up from Louisiana- what it means is- uhm- Ty has nothing, the crowd is starting to CHANT for Guitar again. He wipes his forehead- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you were to come back in- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regular or spicy? Delilah is there, smiling at Pugh, pulling her coat off- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both take the same time to fix up, I just got to know which. Ty and Delilah exchange a long look-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to make mine regular. I like the spicy fine but it always come back to nip me later. She shoots a look to Ty- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important not to bite off more than you can chew. (to Pugh) Yall just make yourself at home. She kisses Ty on the cheek and heads for the kitchen- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck tonight, baby. SHERIFF PUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slap some maynaise on it! Ty smiles, his nerves all gone now- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Might want to wait over there, Sheriff. Don't want to scare off the customers- A CHEER from the crowd.    Sonny has wandered uncertainly onto the stage! TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord- Ty runs up to his microphone, shoots a look to the bar- Maceo is pouring a scotch with one hand, the other wrappe around the wires coming out of the wall. He nods to Ty- Sonny starts to hook his guitar up with a thick COIL OF W then into the dented AMP sitting on a wooden chair beside and pointed out at the crowd. Metalmouth Sims looks on uncomfortably. Ty puts on his biggest grin, easing behind the keyboard- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's what you all been waitin for, people, the noted performer and recordin star-

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Time Trenier strolls in with his sax still in its case, h on his head, exuding his no-sweat attitude. Beside him is YOUNG HENRY, a kid who can't be more than 14, wearing a fedora- TY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -direct from New Orleans, Louisiana-

dialogues.speaker: STAGE
dialogues.text: TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Guitar Sam!!!! A TERRIBLE SQUAWK emits from the amp as Sonny makes the connection- Sheriff Pugh cover his ears- The girls from the store cover their ears, making pained faces- Sonny pulls his guitar away from the amp and the SQUAWK settles to a FUZZY BUZZ. Sonny frowns at the amp- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, folks- must of got kicked on the train. The audience is stone-faced.   Could this really be the m Young Henry steps up and sits behind the DRUM KIT, pullin sticks from inside his shirt- Ty closes his eyes, begins to shake his head in defeat- China Doll looks worried, collecting another cover charge the door- Delilah steps out from the kitchen and looks to the stage worried- Sonny holds his arms out wide, shifting his body to get t BUZZ under control- Dex leans to talk in Junebug's ear- DEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this fool playin at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maceo isn't going to wait to find out. He grabs the wires with both hands, yanks- they hold firm! He looks to the stage, panicked- -as Sonny brings his fingers to the strings and the amp BLASTS the room with a long, trip-hammering, spine-shiver

dialogues.speaker: ELECTRIC GUITAR INTRO
dialogues.text: Ty stands at the piano with his mouth hanging open- Sonny WHOOPS and leans into his microphone- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna hold may baby as tight as I can Tonight she'll know I'm a mighty man! Have you heard the news? There's good rockin tonight! Sonny looks over to Ty, who catches himself and begins to play along. Young Henry is impassive as he plays a fast shuffle on the skins- Ty looks over to Maceo, half-climbing the wall as he trie pull the wires out. Maceo sees Ty, who waves him off- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard the news? There's good rockin tonight! Delilah smiles and presses her hands together, shooting a look upward- DELILAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jesus. Time Trenier has his case open now, the gleaming instrume in one hand, squinting at the mouthpiece as he holds it u the light with the other- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at midnight behind the barn Don't you worry I'll do you no harm The crowd is already CLAPPING and STOMPING in time with t song. Henry starts to hit the two and the four beat hard keep time- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure to bring my rockin shoes Tonight I'm gonna rock away all of my blues!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time Trenier screws the mouthpiece on, puts his horn to h lips and BLOWS right on the beat to take the sax break, walking through the parting crowd to the bandstand! Junebug grabs Opal's hand and they begin to DANCE a modif jitterbug, people spreading to give them room- Sheriff Pugh, hands still over his ears, sits in a corner paying special attention to Opal's hip action- As Time continues to blow, stepping up onto the stage, So keeps urging Metalmouth Sims to come closer to his microp with the harmonica. Sims is hesitant but Sonny keeps wavi closer, closer- Metalmouth shoots a nervous look to Ty, who nods from the piano, so he butts his harp smack against the microphone, takes a deep breath and HONKS his soul out, grabbing the break from Time! The audience goes wild, a half-dozen couples dancing now, others clapping and finger-popping and jumping to the bea where they stand. Sonny shakes out the long CORD attached his guitar- China Doll is trying to keep collecting from the new CUSTOMERS pressing in the door and dance at the same time thrilled by the music. Lonnie and Scratch sneak in behind her as she turns toward the bandstand- Metalmouth wraps up his break and Sonny takes over with t guitar again, making it WAIL as he hops off the stage, st up on a chair, then onto the bar counter! He walks the length of the bar, playing his ass off, hops down at the far end, grins at China Doll and heads out through the door, dragging extension cord behind! Lonnie Scratch hurry to pull slack for him as he steps out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ham and a few other pickers stand outside Toussaint's, be in hand, staring across toward the Honeydripper as Sonny steps out PLAYING with a CROWD behind him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? Sonny steps out into the middle of the crossroads and pla a CAR stopping short of running him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops up on the hood and keeps playing, a TRUCK from th other direction stopping to blast him with its HEADLIGHTS Sonny indicates with his guitar neck to the CROWD emptyin out of Toussaint's that he wants them to follow, then hop down onto a big picker's back and is carried back in to t Honeydripper, still playing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to check that out! A couple dozen patrons move away with him. We HOLD on the doorway as OLD MAN TOUSSAINT comes out to look, puzzled a angry-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time and Metalmouth SING into the same microphone as Sonn plays his way back up to the stage-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard the news? There's good rockin tonight- Have you heard the news? There's good rockin tonight- We FOLLOW as Maceo hustles back and forth, trying to keep with orders for ribs, bring cold beers out from the icebo etc. He suddenly stops in his tracks- Nadine stands before him, looking fatally sexy in a SATIN DRESS she no doubt made herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tire yourself out, Poppa. You an me got bidness together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we do. He hurries past with his arms full of beer, pivoting to c her out from another angle- Dex sees across the room, frowns- Ham is talking to Lucille at the bar, leaning in close to heard over the music-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard the news- There's good rockin tonight! Sonny finishes with a squawking chord and the joint goes

dialogues.speaker: CHEERING, WHISTLING, STOMPING
dialogues.text: SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alla you men grab hold of a woman! You can't find a woman, just grab hold of yourselves- we gonna play this one slow and tight. Sonny goes into the intro for Louis Jordan's Blue Light Boogie. Time lays down a steady rock beat with his sax an Ty joins in at the piano- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They   did   the boogie real   slow With   the   blue lights way   down low They   did   the boogie real   slow With   the   blue lights way   down low Ty joins him- SONNY AND TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did the boogie real slow With the blue lights way down low Ty takes the verse- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to a party With a bobby sox I started swingin All she would do was rock As they join in the chorus, Ty sees- Cool Breeze, strolling in, checking out the action with a proprietary air. Ty looks to Maceo, getting back behind the bar.     Maceo as well, tightening up- Cool Breeze nods to Ty. A slow, sexy SAX BREAK comes up and Ty leaves the piano t cross to the bar. When he gets there Maceo is already counting out a huge pile of BILLS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred forty-two, forty-three, forty-four, five, six, seven, eight, nine- hundred fifty. And they's another fifty in here- Maceo thunks a heavy CLOTH SACK full of change onto the countertop- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky Hardaway don't mind some change, does he? Cool Breeze doesn't even glance at the money, hard-eying instead- COOL BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if Mr. Hardaway was to say let the chumps keep their change, he wants the club back one way or the other? Maceo looks to Ty, who remains impassive, mind working- COOL BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that be? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well- he'd have to take it up with my bidness partner. Ty shifts and we RACK FOCUS to see across the room to She Pugh, receiving his sack of chicken and white bread from Delilah. Ty smiles and waves- Cool Breeze reconsiders his terms- COOL BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sheriff your partner? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Yeah, and he's twice as mean as he is ugly. Cool Breeze grins, scoops up the bills on the counter- COOL BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must want this club awful bad, brother. Cool Breeze hefts the sack of change, shoots a look to th stage and leans over to speak into Ty's ear-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COOL BREEZE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You maybe know this already, but that aint no Guitar Sam. He steps away just as the song ends to APPLAUSE, Ty takin deep sigh of relief. Sonny steps up to the microphone to introduce the next song- TOUSSAINT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You is a lie! A shocked silence. The audience makes way for Old Man Toussaint to come tottering up to the foot of the stage. He points a bony finger at Sonny- TOUSSAINT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You is a lie, boy! I known Sammy since he's drinkin mama's milk, hell, I known his Mama herself when she live up to Plaquemine- and you aint him! The audience looks to Sonny for his defense- Ty holds his breath.   Maceo brings the baseball bat up f behind the bar. Sonny just smiles- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Creole Guitar Sam you talkin bout, Pops. I'm Delta Guitar Sam. Toussaint ponders this a moment, then huffs- TOUSSAINT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we straight on that. JUNEBUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on outa there and let the man play! A CHORUS of CRIES to the same effect, and Sonny crosses b to his microphone- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imonna play you one I come up with today while I was havin my hair cut- He starts into a bouncy INTRO that Metalmouth joins in wi then starts to SING as the crowd starts to dance and clap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh China Doll Can't get you offa my mind! Oh China Doll I can't get you offa my mind! If you be my baby Gonna leave all them others behind! The front row is all girls goggling at Sonny, instant groupies- but we RACK to China Doll, transfixed, as she i drawn toward the stage- SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh China Doll Think about you day and night! Oh China Doll I think about you day and night! Can't forget you baby Oh when you gonna treat me right? Time Trenier steps in for a growling SAX BREAK-

dialogues.speaker: TY
dialogues.text: Ty looks around the crowded, rocking room-

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PUGH
dialogues.text: The Sheriff makes his way through the crowd and out the d The last person he passes turns toward Ty- Possum? But then DANCERS cross in front and he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: TY
dialogues.text: Ty frowns, troubled. Under the sax now we hear a dissonan SLIDE GUITAR, the haunting notes Possum was playing at th train station. Ty searches the crowd-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SLIDE GUITAR continues underneath as we PAN across th crowd dancing- There's Possum again, at the bar, face turned toward Ty.

dialogues.speaker: TY
dialogues.text: We TIGHTEN on TY.   Why is he here?

dialogues.speaker: POSSUM
dialogues.text: Possum turns his head slowly, fixes on something, and we to see Dex and Ham standing toe-to-toe, snarling into eac other's face. We PUNCH IN tighter and tighter on the young men, body language telling us a fight is about to break out-

dialogues.speaker: ECU TY
dialogues.text: Ty desperately pushes his way across the crowded floor to reach them and the FLASHBACKS come again, the SAX MUSIC growing echoey and menacing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 The shaky perspective and over-saturated colors again, ti on the men struggling, the Girl cowering, then Young Tyro twisting the Guitar Man's wrist and thrusting, again and again, hugging close to him, then pulled away and the- -KNIFE falls to the floor, BLOODY, and the- -Guitar Man falls to his hands and knees, his stomach a bloody mess, crawling on all fours and HOWLING and Young Tyrone watching in horror as he is held back by many arms the Girl SCREAMING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 -which becomes Time BLOWING HIS SAX into the microphone- -and Dex reaches for his pistol- -and Ham reaches for his knife, but- -a huge, strong hand clamps down on Dex's wrist- -and another huge hand grabs Ham's wrist! Ty is there, clamping onto them with a grip of iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lighter, bouncier ELECTRIC GUITAR RIFF has replaced the now. Ty looks deep into the eyes of the two surprised pickers- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall in my house, here, gentlemen. Don't have no fightin, don't have no killin, don't have none of that dismal nonsense in my house. Understand? What's your name son? Dex is shaken by the strength of the grip on his arm- DEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dex- Dexter Moncrief. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? HAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamilton Drinkwater. TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, gentlemen, this is the night there won't be no pitiful song written bout you two killin each other. Don't nothin rhyme with `Moncrief' anyhow. Maceo is there now, holding a cardboard BOX in one hand a the BASEBALL BAT in the other- MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a problem here? TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These young men seem to brought something in for our collection. MACEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dex)   Yours first. Ty gently takes the pistol from Dex, regards it grimly be laying it in the box. He turns his attention to Ham- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now yours. He takes the knife from Ham, tosses it in the box- TY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall still need to mess with each other, you go outside and do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty lets go of their wrists-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This world is full of people got no use for us, like to see us in the grave. We don't need to give em any help. The two give each other a final dirty look and move away opposite corners-

dialogues.speaker: STAGE
dialogues.text: Sonny keeps playing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh China Doll Got to let you into my heart! Oh China Doll Got to let you into my heart! I surrender darlin I loved you from the very start! Ty rushes to the piano, joins in jamming with the other players-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick sits on a tomb, drinking wine, MOONLIGHT spilling o Bertha Mae's fresh-dug GRAVE. He listens to the MUSIC in far distance-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound like the music movin on again, darlin. The way it always do. He listens for another moment, sighs-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to make room for whoever comin next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN RISES next to the Honeydripper sign. We hear the CROW of a distant ROOSTER. The parking lot is empty but f Ty's old Ford- Ty, exhausted but happy, steps out front. He pastes a SNI that says HELD OVER! across the Guitar Sam poster-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boy can play some. Ty turns. Possum is on the road, guitar strung over his shoulder, feeling his way with a red-tipped CANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leavin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aint needed round here no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)     Oh-- down the road. Ty watches the blind man move away for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone- Ty turns as Maceo steps out, equally tired and unshaven-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you talkin to out here? Maceo looks down the road, but Possum is nowhere to be se Ty shrugs-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scratch and Lonnie are set to pretend to play music again Lonnie spreads his fingers over the keys he's drawn on th board- -and begins to PLAY!    Fast, rhythmic boogie piano-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of a Diddley bow, Scratch is pretending to tune t two strings on a `guitar' made of a plank of wood and bal wire. He carefully takes a length of clothesline rope leading from the guitar, tacks the end of it to the wall the shack, plugging himself in. He looks to Lonnie, who nods, and then- -he begins to PLAY in time with Lonnie. We CRANE UP and away from them, the MUSIC spilling out ov the field- It sounds a whole lot like rock and roll.
